title: Memory Management for Real-Time Appearance-Based Loop Closure Detection
abstract:
Loop closure detection is the process involved when trying to find a match
between the current and a previously visited locations in SLAM. Over time, the
amount of time required to process new observations increases with the size of
the internal map, which may influence real-time processing. In this paper, we
present a novel real-time loop closure detection approach for large-scale and
long-term SLAM. Our approach is based on a memory management method that keeps
computation time for each new observation under a fixed limit. Results
demonstrate the approach's adaptability and scalability using four standard
data sets.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
